meanings.definition: To view or present in a romantic way
meanings.sent1: She enjoys romanticising old love letters she finds in the attic.
meanings.sent2: He has a habit of romanticising every sunset he sees.
meanings.sent3: By romanticising her daily walks, she turned them into magical adventures.
meanings.sent4: His paintings have a way of romanticising even the simplest scenes.
meanings.sent5: The author's words were like a brush, romanticising the world with each stroke.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more attractive or idealized than it really is
meanings.sent1: The advertisement was romanticising the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent2: She was romanticising the idea of a perfect vacation in her mind.
meanings.sent3: He was romanticising the thought of never having to do chores again.
meanings.sent4: The movie was romanticising the life of a struggling artist.
meanings.sent5: The politician was skilled at romanticising his achievements to gain votes.
